result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel LC Abston Jr

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:45 PM Defendant Daniel LC Abston Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Murali S. Jasti in court for Daniel LC Abston Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy L McMiller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests plea/sentencing, address verified.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
02:08 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Murali S. Jasti.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case to follow 22CF444.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle not registered to the defendant without written consent from the lawful owner on their person. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:17 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
